Utilities

Class ImageCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • Utilities.ImageCollection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ImageCollection
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Holds images for a game. It will keep them orderly, if enabled. Also contains methods for GUI drawing.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • Draw

        public void Draw(Image2D i,
        Vector2 pos)
        Draws an Image passed into it. Sets depth to 0. Useful if the user does not wish to use depth-sorting. The position passed in will be the center of the image.
        Parameters:
        i - the Image2D to be drawn
        pos - the Position at which the Image2D will be drawn

      • Draw

        public void Draw(Image2D i,
        Vector2 pos,
        int depth)
        Draws an Image passed into it at the depth provided. The Higher depth means it will be drawn later, or on top of others. The position passed in will be the center of the image.
        Parameters:
        i - the Image2D to be drawn
        pos - the Position at which the Image2D will be drawn
        depth - the depth at which the image will be drawn

      • Render

        public void Render(java.awt.Graphics g,
          java.awt.image.ImageObserver c)
        This method draws all of the Images from the collection onto the JPanel, using the Graphics. If depth sorting is enabled, then everything will be drawn in the order of least to greatest, in terms of depth. For each item with the same depth, they are drawn on a first in, last out basis. Otherwise, everything is drawn on a first in, first out basis.
        Parameters:
        g - -graphics to be used
        c - -JPanel or Game the Items will be drawn in. NOTE: the JPanel can be a child class of the Game Class.

        Parameters:

      • drawArc

        public void drawArc(Vector2 pos,
           int width,
           int height,
           int startAngle,
           int arcAngle,
           java.awt.Color c,
           int depth)
        Draws an Arc inside of the rectangle, given by the upper left hand origin, width, and height. The width and height are the major and minor axis, depending on the size. Given these will determine whether or not the arc will be circular or ellipsoidal. The measurement of angle is at 90 degrees (pi/2 radians) going clockwise.
        Parameters:
        pos - upper left hand corner of the rectangle surrounding the arc
        width - width of the rectangle surrounding the arc
        height - height of the rectangle surrounding the arc
        startAngle - starting angle of the arc
        arcAngle - how far the arc will go (final angle is this angle plus start angle
        c - Color of the arc
        depth - Image depth the arc will be drawn at

      • drawLine

            Vector2 pos2,
            java.awt.Color c,
            int depth)
        Draws a line which will be drawn between those two points
        Parameters:
        pos1 - one of the positions
        pos2 - the other position
        c - the color of the line
        depth - the depth at which the line will be drawn

        Parameters:

        width - width of the rectangle for the oval
        height - height of the rectangle for the oval
        c - color of the oval
        depth - image depth the oval will be drawn at

      • drawPolyline

        public void drawPolyline(int[] xPoints,
                int[] yPoints,
                int nPoints,
                java.awt.Color c,
                int depth)
        Similar to a line, but has many points together, instead of two.
        Parameters:
        xPoints - array of the x-coordinates of the points
        yPoints - array of the y-coordinates of the points
        nPoints - number of points to be made
        c - color of the line
        depth - image depth of the polyline

        Parameters:

      • drawRoundRect

        public void drawRoundRect(Vector2 pos,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 int arcWidth,
                 int arcHeight,
                 java.awt.Color c,
                 int depth)
        Draws a rectangle with round edges. Note, non-angular
        Parameters:
        pos - upper left hand corner of the rectangle
        width - width of the rectangle
        height - height of the rectangle
        arcWidth - width of the arcs in the corners
        arcHeight - height of the arcs in the corner
        c - color of the rectangle
        depth - image depth of the rounded rectangle

      • drawRoundRect

        public void drawRoundRect(Rect r,
                 int arcWidth,
                 int arcHeight,
                 java.awt.Color c,
                 int depth)
        Draws a rectangle with round edges.
        Parameters:
        r - the rectangle which will become round with edges. Note, non-angular.
        width - width of the rectangle
        height - height of the rectangle
        arcWidth - width of the arcs in the corners
        arcHeight - height of the arcs in the corner
        c - color of the rectangle
        depth - image depth of the rounded rectangle

      • fillArc

        public void fillArc(Vector2 pos,
           int width,
           int height,
           int startAngle,
           int arcAngle,
           java.awt.Color c,
           int depth)
        Draws a filled in arc. Equivalent to getting a section of the disk inscribed inside of the given rectangle. The start angle with be the angle the arc is drawn at, measured clockwise from 90 Degrees (pi/2 radians). The arc angle with be the measure of the angle, going from the start angle, and ending at the startAngle plus arcAngle, going clockwise.
        Parameters:
        pos - upper left hand corner of the rectangle arc is inscribed in.
        width - width of the rectangle
        height - height of the rectangle
        startAngle - starting angle
        arcAngle - extent of the arc
        c - color the filled in arc will be
        depth - image depth of the filled in arc

      • fillOval

        public void fillOval(Vector2 pos,
            int width,
            int height,
            java.awt.Color c,
            int depth)
        Draws a filled in oval, also known as a disk. The given position is the upper left hand corner of the rectangle the oval is inscribed in.
        Parameters:
        pos - upper left hand corner of the rectangle
        width - width of the rectangle
        height - height of the rectangle
        c - color of the filled in oval
        depth - image depth of the oval
